query: During the first week of August 2015, one of the NASA Astronomy Pictures of the Day shows the lights of a city on the horizon. The namesake of this city also has a landmark building in Chicago named after him. What is the name of the architectural firm that designed this landmark building? Give the first name appearing in the name of the firm as of June 2023.

tasks.description: Найти информацию о NASA Astronomy Pictures of the Day за первую неделю августа 2015 года.

result.query: Найти информацию о NASA Astronomy Pictures of the Day за первую неделю августа 2015 года.

facts.fact: On August 1, 2015, the Astronomy Picture of the Day featured ESO 137-001, a galaxy losing dust and gas, impacting its star formation.
The Astronomy Picture of the Day on August 7, 2015, showcased a full view of Earth and the Moon, highlighting Hurricane Dolores.

sources.title: APOD: 2015 August 1 - Stripping ESO 137-001 - NASA
sources.snippet:
# Astronomy Picture of the Day

Discover the cosmos! Each day a different image or photograph of our fascinating universe is featured, along with a brief explanation written by a professional astronomer.

2015 August 1

   Stripping ESO 137-001    
 Image Credit: NASA, ESA, CXC [...] darker blue trails stretching over 400,000 light-years toward the bottom right. The significant loss of dust and gas will make new star formation difficult for this galaxy. A yellowish elliptical galaxy, lacking in star forming dust and gas, is just to the right of ESO 137-001 in the frame. [...] Explanation:  Spi

sources.title: APOD: 2015 August 7 – Full Earth, Full Moon - UCL
sources.snippet:
# Astronomy Picture of the Day

Discover the cosmos! Each day a different image or photograph of our fascinating universe is featured, along with a brief explanation written by a professional astronomer.

2015 August 7

   Full Moon, Full Earth    
 Image Credit:  NASA, NOAA/DSCOVR [...] at the upper left. Planet Earth's north pole is near 11 o'clock, with the North America visited by Hurricane Dolores near centre. Slight colour shifts are visible around the lunar edge, an artifact of the Moon's motion through the field caused by combining the camera's separate exposures taken in quick success

sources.title: Space Image of the Day Gallery (August 2015)
sources.snippet:
Tuesday, August 11, 2015: Barred spiral galaxy NGC 428 lies approximately 48 million light-years away from Earth in the constellation of Cetus (The Sea Monster). A residual spiral shape remains, but the galaxy's structure appears distorted and warped, possibly resulting from a collision between two galaxies. William Herschel discovered NGC 428 in December 1786. Image released Aug. 10, 2015.

— Tom Chao

tasks.description: Найти информацию о landmark building в Чикаго, названном в честь человека из предыдущей задачи.

facts.fact: The Abraham Lincoln Monument is a designated Chicago landmark.
The Abraham Lincoln Monument was designated as a landmark on December 12, 2001.
The Abraham Lincoln Monument was completed in 1887.
The monument is located in Lincoln Park, Chicago.

result.summary: The Abraham Lincoln Monument is a Chicago landmark completed in 1887 and designated as a landmark in 2001, located in Lincoln Park.
